page.title: 15A Survey of Sissinghurst
page.content: Sissinghurst is a small village Just to the north of Cranbrook.It used to be called Milk House Street.It has a primary school,a church,a garage,a few shops and a pub on either side of the main street.Recently shops have closed such as the baker,butcher and shoe repairs.There are two antiques shops in the village and a tea shop has just opened.There is also a restaurant which ed two years ago.A three course lunch costs 3.75 and a typical dinner between 8.00-11.00pounds.Bookings are taken from passing trade and surrounding villages.The village has changed a lot. Villagers shop in Cranbrook or elsewhere.Houses have been inproved becaey are an investment.Local residents are concerned about vandalism and young people hanging about.They are also concerned about the loss of footpaths which are widely used
